column3: $1. Spray 9-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. $2. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or cast iron skillet over medium heat until shimmering. $3. Chop and add leeks
column5: garlic and red pepper flakes and cook
column7: until vegetables sweat but do not brown
column8: about 4 minutes. $4. Add tomato paste and cook
column10: 1 minute more. $5. Add chard leaves and cook
column13: about 3 minutes. $6. Add crushed tomatoes and orzo and bring to a boil
column15: and remove from heat. $7. Add feta
column17: and salt and pepper to taste. $8. Stir well and transfer to baking dish
column18: smoothing top. $9. Cover dish tightly with aluminum foil. $10. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes
column19: then remove foil and bake until top of orzo has browned slightly
column20: about 20 minutes longer. Allow to sit for 10 minutes before serving.
